crypto.name: Baby Bundle
crypto.desc:
A~Z

A crane flew by, and delivered this baby chall. I can't understand a word it speaks.

crypto.name: Golden Ticket
crypto.desc:
Giapppp

Can you help Charles - who doesn't have any knowledge about cryptography, get the golden ticket and have a trip to Willy Wonka's factory ?

crypto.name: Heaven or Hell
crypto.desc:
EggRoll

Do you believe in fate?

crypto.name: OTRU
crypto.desc:
EggRoll

AnOther crypTo foR U :)

Note. In local test, you may need previous version of Sage like 9.6 in order to construct Quaternion algebra with base ring Zmod(N).

crypto.name: Seedy
crypto.desc:
Mistsu

Can you recover the flag when it looks a little bit random?

crypto.name: Tensor Galore
crypto.desc:
A~Z

CSIDH is so 2018. Wake up babe, new class group action just dropped.

crypto.name: irrandomcible
crypto.desc:
A~Z
And in the left corner! Beer in hand, degen anime in mind! You all recognize him, the drunk cryptoman!! SOOOOOOOOOON HAAAAAARRIIIIIIII

While attempting to become as good as my idol Haari-sama of the Soon clan, I got drunk and randomized the flag. Please help.

misc.name: Minecraft HACKED
misc.desc:
JoshL

You might remember the cat coordinate exploit used to find LiveOverflow. Well, pumpkin steve has captured LiveOverflow, and it is your job to find LiveOverflow again. But this time he left something else behind...
PLEASE TEST YOUR SOLVE LOCALLY BEFORE STARTING AN INSTANCE

misc.name: NM PZ easy
misc.desc:
jazzzooo

Just a few completely random locations.

misc.name: memoryfs
misc.desc:
__jw

Are you sick and tired of law enforcement busting down your door, stealing your hard drives, and then finding all your pirated movies? Well, fret no more, because with MemoryFS, once those goons unplug your computer, your files are wiped!

pwn.name: Busy Gambler Pwner
pwn.desc:
Zerotistic

So huh I spent the whole month gambling... And haven't done a single work!! I have a few binaries I really need to exploit, please help me !! :( Note: please check template.py as it contains useful information

pwn.name: Write me
pwn.desc:
JoshL

We all know the format string %n writes to data memory. Cool! Now do that 16 times. Without control of the arguments. In a single printf call??? wtf?

pwn.name: a silence of three parts
pwn.desc:
unvariant

I love leakless heap exploitation!!!

NOTE: the intended solution requires no more than 8 bits of brute force.

rev.name: Game
rev.desc:
Elvis

I have pulled a game from https://github.com/shlomnissan/trex-runner and modified it to add a reward for players who achieve a high enough score. Check it out!

rev.name: Hide n Seek
rev.desc:
Elvis

Do you want to play a game? I want to play a game. Let's play hide n seek. The rule is simple: Find the correct password. (Sorry for string idekCTF 2023. This was supposed to be an idekCTF 2023 challenge, but it never happened)

rev.name: Ribasu Metronome
rev.desc:
Rythm

Utaha made a flag checker that works most of the time. Sometimes it's hard to make up your mind.

rev.name: The Moon
rev.desc:
Trixter & Ling

Someone kept talking about something how they used the moon to hide their flag but I'm not sure what that was all about...

rev.name: nlibs baby
rev.desc:
JoshL

In celebration on qualifying for DEFCON CTF Finals, I have prepared a throwback challenge!

Note: There's a $50 USD author bounty on this challenge first blood.

web.name: Hello
web.desc:
Abdelhameed Ghazy

Just to warm you up for the next Fight :"D

Note: the admin bot is not on the same machine as the challenge itself and the .chal.idek.team:1337 URL should be used for the admin bot URL

web.name: crator
web.desc:
__jw

I made a new website to compete against my friends to see who could write faster code. Unfortunately, I don't actually know how to write that much code. Don't tell them, but ChatGPT wrote this entire website for me. Can you solve the problems for me?

web.name: flamethrower
web.desc:
downgrade & icesfont

I added this cool project called flamethrower to my product site, hopefully it doesn't have any silly bugs

web.name: includeme
web.desc:
downgrade

another minimalist, frontend-less, challenge because i'm bad at writing server-side challenges

note: it takes ~5 minutes for an instance to start up, please test locally first :3

web.name: srcdoc memos
web.desc:
icesfont

Even the admin bot forgets things sometimes, which is why they wrote a memo and forgot about it. Can you jog their memory?

NB: The admin bot on remote does not match the bot.js given in the old distribution exactly.

In particular, the remote admin bot is running on an old version: HeadlessChrome/107.0.5296.0, whereas the intended solution works on latest.

This means that there exist unintended solutions that abuse bugs in this older version of Chromium.

A revenge challenge will be released later with the admin bot as part of the challenge itself (rather than relying on the redpwn bot) and with Chromium up-to-date.

For now, the distribution has been updated to match remote in order to aid local testing; http://localhost:3000/srcdoc-memos provides the same (outdated) admin bot used on remote.

web.name: srcdoc memos revenge
web.desc:
icesfont

This is a revenge challenge for srcdoc-memos

Note: Exploits should target to http://localhost:1337

hint 1: policy containers in chromium

hint 2: what can you do with a srcdoc without csp, even if you don't have scripting?

web.name: untitled smarty challenge
web.desc:
downgrade

We're using Smarty 5, with open_basedir, AND don't even pass user input directly into a template, surely this isn't insecure. Oh wait...
